alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 7:34PM EDT until August 29 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Montgomery and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Troy, Badin Lake, Plyler, Badin, Richfield, New London, Morrow Mountain State Park, Lake Tillery and Eldorado. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
